thread.title: Breaking down the results of 86 Super Bowl prop bets | For The Win
thread.title_full: Breaking down the results of 86 Super Bowl prop bets | For The Win

author: Luke Kerr-Dineen
title: Breaking down the results of 86 Super Bowl prop bets | For The Win
text:
Breaking down the results of 86 Super Bowl prop bets Breaking down the results of 86 Super Bowl prop bets By Luke Kerr-Dineen February 6, 2017 2:32 pm Follow @LukeKerrDineen 371 shares 
We ranked a million prop bets from a variety of different sites ahead of Super Bowl 51, so now’s the time we cycle through the results of some of those wagers. The ones below were from Bovada. 
Study up for next year! 1. How long will it take for Luke Bryan to sing the US National Anthem? 
Over/Under 2 minutes 9 seconds 
OUTCOME: UNDER 2. What will Luke Bryan be wearing when he starts singing the US National Anthem? 
Blue Jeans 1/2 Any other pants or shorts 3/2 
OUCTOME: ANY OTHER PANTS OR SHORTS 3. Will Luke Bryan be wearing a hat when he appears on screen before singing the US National Anthem? 
Yes +140 (7/5) 4. Will Luke Bryan forget or omit a word from the Official US National Anthem? 
Yes 4/1 No 1/7 
OUTCOME: NO 5. Will any Player on the Falcons or Patriots roster be seen kneeling during the National Anthem on TV during live broadcast? 
Yes +150 (3/2) 6. How many times will Trump be said on TV during Broadcast? 
Over/Under 1½ 7. Who will Donald Trump pick to win the game? 
Patriots 1/10 8. What will be higher on Super Bowl Sunday? 
Tom Brady Rushing Yards +150 (3/2) Donald Trump’s Interview will Bill O’Reilly in minutes -200 (1/2) 
OUTCOME: TOM BRADY RUSHING YARDS 
(Editor’s note: The true upset of the night!) 9. How many times will “Gronk” or “Gronkowski” be said on TV during live broadcast? 
Over/Under 3 10. How many times will Arthur Blank be shown on TV during the Broadcast? 
Over/Under 2 11. How many times will Robert Kraft be shown on TV during the Broadcast? 
Over/Under 2½ 12. How many times will Giselle Bundchen be shown on TV during the Broadcast? 
Over 1½ +110 (11/10) Under 1½ -150 (2/3) 
OUTCOME: OVER 
(Editor’s note: The lock of the night, one that’s even bigger in retrospect) EPA 13. How many times will “deflate” or “deflategate” be said on TV during live broadcast? 
Over 1½ EVEN (1/1) Under 1½ -140 (5/7) 
OUTCOME: UNDER 
(Editor’s note: Never even close) 14. How many times will J.J. Watt be mentioned on TV during live broadcast? 
Over 1 -140 (5/7)
